overview: Abdominal pain is pain that occurs between the chest and pelvic regions. It can be crampy, achy, dull, intermittent, or sharp. It's also called a stomachache.

causes.description: Discomfort or burning in the upper abdomen, often after eating
Illness caused by eating contaminated food
Inflammation of the stomach and intestines
Chronic condition affecting the large intestine
Infrequent bowel movements or difficult passage of stools
symptoms: Fewer than 3 bowel movements per week
Sudden pain in lower right abdomen
Sudden, intense pain in upper right abdomen

causes.description: Hard deposits of minerals and salts in the kidneys
symptoms: Severe pain in side and back

causes.description: Sores in the lining of the stomach or small intestine
Chronic inflammation of the digestive tract

emergency_symptoms: Pain that lasts more than 24 hours
Pain that gets worse over time

home_remedies.description: Avoid strenuous activity and get plenty of rest
Apply a heating pad or warm compress to the affected area
Drink clear fluids like water, broth, or clear juices
Eat bland foods like rice, toast, bananas, and applesauce
Stay away from spicy, fatty, or acidic foods
Consider antacids, pain relievers, or anti-diarrheal medications as appropriate

when_to_see_doctor: Pain that is severe or doesn't improve
Pain that interferes with daily activities
Pain accompanied by other concerning symptoms
Pain in people over 50 years old
Pain in people with a family history of digestive problems
